definition: Six schools of pre-Han philosophy, as analyzed by 司馬談|司马谈[Si1 ma3 Tan2] (儒家[Ru2 jia1], 道家[Dao4 jia1], 陰陽|阴阳[yin1 yang2], 法家[Fa3 jia1], 名家[Ming2 jia1], and 墨家[Mo4 jia1])

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Chinese landscape painting in Qing Dynasty reached its peak during"six artists in early Qing Dynasty".
sentences.chinese: 清代山水畫，發展至“清初六家”，可以說達到頂峯。

sentences.english: Among the Eight Great Scholars of Tang and Song Dynasty, six were clustered in the capital then.
sentences.chinese: 唐宋八大家中的宋六家皆羣集於京城。

sentences.english: There were six Premier League clubs yesterday morning trying to get the boy.
sentences.chinese: 昨天早上有六家英超俱樂部想要得到這個小夥子。

sentences.english: Shenzhen has 56 quite big horse- ridings clubs.
sentences.chinese: 深圳有五六家比較大的馬術俱樂部。

definition: many schools of thought/many people or households
the whole family/the same family/the family ... (when preceded by a family name)/group
privately run (i.e. by a company, not the state)

the four elements: earth, water, fire, and wind (Buddhism)/the four freedoms: speaking out freely, airing views fully, holding great debates, and writing big-character posters, 大鳴大放|大鸣大放[da4 ming2 da4 fang4], 大辯論|大辩论[da4 bian4 lun4], 大字報|大字报[da4 zi4 bao4] (PRC)
to inject funds/to put money into (the market)
to lead (an animal by the head)/to take the lead/to coordinate (a combined operation)/to mediate/a go-between (e.g. marriage broker)
